H0.text: The shape of continents of Earth was the subject that scientists were able to learn more about using the first powerful telescopes built during the early 1600s.

H1.text: The effect of storms and hurricanes is what scientists were able to learn more about during the early 1600s by using the first powerful telescopes.

H2.text: Forces changing the surface of Earth are the subject scientists were able to learn more about during the early 1600s by using the first powerful telescopes.

H3.text: Planets and moons in the solar system are the subjects scientists learned more about during the early 1600s when the first powerful telescopes were built.

A4.text: With this last instrument, he began a series of astronomical observations in October or November of 1609, observing the satellites of Jupiter, hills and valleys on the moon, the phases of Venus and spots on the sun.
